title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
I get orange/green light.  Board does not power on or fan spin.

had some small spots of corrosion - replaced r1517 and c2450

PPBUS_G3H 8.4
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS 8.4
PPBUS_S5_HS_COPMUTING_ISNS 8.4
PPDCIN_G3H 16.07
PP3V42_G3H 3.42
PPVRTC_G3H 3.42
PP5V_S0 - 0
PP3V3_S5 0
PPV3V_S0 0
PP1V8_S0 0
PP1V5_S0 0

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
You're probably missing SMC_PM_G2_EN

Voltage of SMC_PM_G2_EN and SMC_BC_ACOK?

I can't find R1517 on my schematic by the way

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
SMC_BC_ACOK - 3.394
SMC_PM_G2_EN - 3.423

and sorry...i meant R5017

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
I was rechecking work on the replaced caps and noticed this test point missing.  would this stop board from powering up?

[ATTACH type="full" width="60%"]29533._xfImport[/ATTACH]

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
No missing that test point would at best cause issues in S0, but you're not even fully getting into S5

Voltage of PP5V_S5, P5VP3V3_VREG3 & P5VP3V3_VREF2?
Voltage of P3V3S5_EN_R?
Voltage of PPVIN_S5_P5VP3V3 probed at C7200?
Voltage of Pin 12 of U7201? (Probed at the pin or otherwise as close as possible)

I'm suspecting U7201 trouble

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
PP5V_S5 - 5.040
P5VP3V3_VREG3 - 3.304
P5VP3V3_VREF2 - 2.003
P3V3S5_EN_R - 3.423
C7200 - 8.4 (my does schematic not say PPVIN_S5_P5VP3V3.  it says PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS)
Pin 12 is P5V3V3_REG_EN - 3.422

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
R7206, R7216, R7238, R7246 and R7260/61 within specifications?

Resistance to ground on PP3V3_S5 in Ohms?

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
r7206 - 247k
r7216 - 1.248k ( this is off  will change)
R7238 - 7.5
R7246 - 1.250
R7260 - 6.98 (this is off will change)
R7261 - 7.00 (this is off will change)

Resistance to ground on PP3V3_S5 - .3-.4

is it weird that so many resistors are bad?  just wondering before i replace them.

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
[QUOTE="wirelessplanet, post: 29558"]is it weird that so many resistors are bad? just wondering before i replace them.[/QUOTE]

The resistors are all good, in almost all cases a resistor fails high resistance. The lower resistance measurements are simply because the electricity found a different way to flow


The resistance to ground on PP3V3_S5 is bad though, that shoudn't be so low.

Inject 1V into it and start with something like 2 Amps and increase after a while if nothing noticeable heats up. Only increase voltage if you're running into an amperage limit
Its probably a capacitor or IC shorted somewhere, see what heats up. Use alcohol when you have found a spot that is somewhat hot, unless you want to make the same mistake as me by burning the tip of your finger on a shitty 0402 capacitor thats burning hot ;)

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message:
So i shouldn't replace them?

r7216 should be 6.65k and i'm only getting 1.248
r7260 should be 23.2 and i'm only getting 7
r7261should be 10 and i'm only getting 7

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: No, dont replace the resistors. Remove L7260, see which pad the short is on, and the inject power as Smiba has explained.

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: so the power supply is maxing out at 1.5amps. c9487 is the only thing that gets slightly warm, not boiling hot. its showed a short on multimeter so i removed and short was still there. any other ideas?

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: so i tried with freeze test instead.  found the shorted cap.  c7290.  now i have fan spin.

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: To battle the supply maxing out: increase the voltage, the maximum allowed in this case is 3.3V.

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: should i be worried about that missing testpoint?  computer turns on and works now.

title: [SOLVED]820-3209-a No Power
message: Unlikely, I think if the PCH was missing its DAC voltage the system woudn't work or at least not pass AHT. Should be alright :)
